html:
Amongst the surprises will be Code Vein 2, The Blood of Dawnwalker, and Tekken 8.

Bandai Namco's Summer Showcase is set to debut on 2nd July.

The trailer advertising the event is barely 30 seconds long, but it packs in quite a bit, confirming we can expect the "world game reveal" of a new My Hero Academia game.

We'll also get a new trailer for Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree, a "gameplay deep dive" of Digimon Story Time Stranger, and more, including appearances from Code Vein 2, The Blood of Dawnwalker, Death Note Killer Within, Everybody's Golf Hot Shots, Little Nightmares 3, Patapon 1+2 Replay, Shadow Labyrinth, Super Robot Wars Y, and Tekken 8.

Earlier this month, we also learned that a new Tales Of remaster is on the way. As part of the 30th anniversary celebration, a blink-and-you'll-miss-it tease popped up on social media, confirming there's a new Tales of Remastered project in the works. As for which one? Well, maybe we'll find out on 2nd July...
